Description: Complete scarab, made of steatite. At the highest part of the back the glaze is rubbed offed. Some details carved, whitish-grey colour with incised lines. No details of the back with elytra and prothorax are shown, except for a two 0.5 cm long lines at the site edge of the back. The area of the head is quite stylized, head and eyes are not shown but there is a small curved part between two lines. The clypeus is indicated with five lobes, and outside of the clypeus a small area is shown that could be either plates or part of legs, with hair indicated on the right. The side shows two lines leaving a line for the legs that are no further carved in details above the base line. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base. In the centre a mn-sign. To the right of it a second sign that is joined to it in the base that could have been a sun disc or maybe an uraeus?. Around this two signs nine circles with a hole in the middle. Perforated along its longitudinal side.
